thread.title: Alastair Cook approaching double-century as England pass follow-on mark
thread.title_full: Alastair Cook approaching double-century as England pass follow-on mark

title: Alastair Cook approaching double-century as England pass follow-on mark
text:
Alastair Cook approaching double-century as England pass follow-on mark 16 Oct 2015 07:46:57 
comments 
Alastair Cook neared his third Test double-century as England eased past the follow-on mark, and a stalemate loomed against Pakistan at the Zayed Cricket Stadium. 
Cook (188no) had been at the crease for approaching 10 hours in the first Test, as he and Joe Root took their stand to 65 out of 350 for three in reply to 523 for eight declared by mid-morning on day four. 
The England captain had a minor moment of fortune, only his second after being dropped the previous evening, when on 173 this time he inside-edged Wahab Riaz low to diving wicketkeeper Sarfraz Ahmed. 
It was barely a half-chance, which did not stick and would have been a brilliant catch if it had. 
Pakistan's bowlers began well, and it took almost 11 overs before Cook counted England's first boundary of the morning - a sweep off Zulfiqar Babar. 
Root followed up with a cover-driven four in the next over, off Imran Khan, and then an inside-edge inches past his off-stump which also beat Sarfraz to take the deficit under 200. 
Imran was disappointed again two balls later when Root survived an lbw review on 24, his advance down the pitch helping to save him via umpire's call. Related Sport News
